title: Binary Tree Height
algorithmDescription: Calculate the height of a binary tree using recursive traversal
detailedDescription: Write a program that calculates the height of a binary tree. The height is the number of edges on the longest path from root to leaf. An empty tree has height -1, and a tree with single node has height 0. Input format: First line contains number of nodes, followed by node values in level-order (use -1 for null).
hints: Height of tree = 1 + max(height of left subtree, height of right subtree)
Consider using queue for level-order tree construction
commonMistakes: Off-by-one errors in counting edges vs nodes
Not properly constructing tree from input
solutionApproach: Build the tree from level-order input, then recursively compute height by finding max of left and right subtree heights plus 1. Handle null nodes appropriately.
testCaseCriteria: Must correctly calculate height for various tree structures including empty, single node, balanced, and skewed trees

testCases.description: Tree with root and two children has height 1
Complete binary tree with 3 levels has height 2
